title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3: EDUCATION COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: By 2024, families and communities are equipped with knowledge of their right to free education and are actively demanding access to quality early learning and basic education for out-of-school and overage children, including adolescents., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024 more school-aged girls and boys, especially the disadvantaged, have equitable access to quality inclusive early childhood and basic education.

mailing-address.narrative: Sekou Toure Avenue Mamba Point Monrovia

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 2550/A0/09/882 OUTCOME 2:. EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, families and communities are equipped with knowledge of their right to free education and are actively demanding access toquality early learning and basic education for out-of-school and overage children, including adolescents.

description.narrative: Community engagement has a critical role to play in sustaining demand creation for education and thus requires a comprehensive strategy to engage communities to take on this role. In this light, a robust communication strategy has been developed with an exhaustive representation of community structures and institutions. These will link with head teachers and schools within their jurisdiction to engage in enrolment drive campaigns and strengthen school support groups through School-Based Management Committees (SBMCs), and re-energize Parents Teachers Associations(PTAs) and Mothers’ Associations | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/01/2022
